email.description: Email MCP server for sending notifications and reading inbox. Used as a fallback notification channel when Slack is unavailable or for email-only recipients. Set the environment variables above before use.

notes.setup: 1. Set EMAIL_SMTP_HOST to your SMTP server (e.g., smtp.office365.com, smtp.gmail.com). 2. Set EMAIL_SMTP_PORT (typically 587 for TLS). 3. Set EMAIL_FROM_ADDRESS to the sender address (e.g., it-support-agent@your-org.com). 4. Set EMAIL_AUTH_USER and EMAIL_AUTH_TOKEN for SMTP authentication. 5. Ensure the from address is authorized to send on behalf of IT Support.

tool_descriptions.send_email: Send an email to specified recipients (write operation — always requires human approval at L1-L2)
tool_descriptions.get_inbox: Read recent emails from the IT support inbox (read operation)

notes.level_1_permissions: At Autonomy Level 1: get_inbox only. send_email requires human execution — agent drafts the email.
notes.level_2_permissions: At Autonomy Level 2: get_inbox allowed. send_email requires explicit human approval before each send.
notes.level_3_permissions: At Autonomy Level 3: send_email enabled for internal recipients only. External recipients still require human approval.
notes.level_4_permissions: At Autonomy Level 4: send_email for internal recipients. External recipients always require human approval.
notes.safety: Email sending ALWAYS requires human approval for external recipients at ALL autonomy levels. The agent must never send emails outside the organization without explicit confirmation.
